statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Michael Finley scored 12 of his 30 points during a breakout third quarter, leading the Dallas Mavericks past Minnesota 125-117 on Saturday night and ending the Timberwolves' six-game winning streak.
article.headline: Mavs' highest-scoring effort of season derails Wolves
article.linkText: Mavs' Big 3 snap T-Wolves' six-game streak
article.story:
DALLAS (AP) -- Michael Finley threw down dunks and a 3-pointer. Steve Nash set up most of those shots and had his own highlight with a fadeaway jumper while falling out of bounds. And Dirk Nowitzki made his presence felt inside and out.
Finley

Not bad for only 5 minutes. With Dallas' Big Three leading a big third-quarter burst, the Mavericks scored their most points of the season in a 125-117 victory over Minnesota on Saturday night, ending the Timberwolves' six-game winning streak with a thud. After allowing only 89 points per game during the roll, Minnesota gave up 90 after three quarters and wound up with the most points against it this season -- by eight. Finley scored 30 points, Nash had 25 and Nowitzki 21 and a season-high 15 rebounds. Each also had at least six assists, helping Juwan Howard score 19 points and Tim Hardaway 16. "Everybody's clicking," said Hardaway, who also had six assists. "Everybody is finding each other and everybody is trusting each other right now, so we're having fun." Minnesota, which won by an average of 17 points during its roll, was up seven early in the second half when Finley, Nash and Nowitzki took over. They combined for 22 points on a 24-8 run -- which took only 5:07 -- that put Dallas ahead for good. "We were ready to take control of the game," Minnesota coach Flip Saunders said. "But then they started getting rebounds and got rejuvenated and re-energized." Finley tied it at 64 with a dunk off a great feed from Nowitzki, then put the Mavericks ahead by cutting through traffic for another slam. He also had a 3-pointer and a three-point play on consecutive possessions, followed by a 3-pointer by Nash that capped the big run with the Mavericks leading 81-72. Dallas' lead peaked at 13. The Timberwolves got within six in the final 2 minutes, but a jumper by Howard and a layup by Nowitzki doused the threat. "We shot really good and moved the ball around well," Nash said. "Everything was just working for us." The Mavericks expected more games like this from Nowitzki, Finley and Nash, but haven't had many where all three were on. Their relatively slow start to this season left them behind Minnesota in the standings, something they definitely noticed. "Tonight was a good test," Hardaway said. "We learned what we need to do to win as a team." The Mavericks scored five more than they had in any game this season and had 14 more than they'd scored in any four-quarter game. Dallas improved to 11-0 when scoring at least 100 -- a mark reached on a Finley 3-pointer with more than 9 minutes left -- compared to 4-9 when scoring in double digits. This was the Mavs' second straight blowout win, having beaten Cleveland by 20 on Thursday night. Saunders noted that Dallas made seven more 3-pointers than his team, a 21-point difference. The Mavs also hit 13 more free throws. The Timberwolves could blame their off night on fatigue as this was their fourth game in five days. They get to go home and rest up for their next game: at home against Dallas on Tuesday night. "That's the positive," Saunders said. Wally Szczerbiak scored 27 points and Kevin Garnett had 23 points and only five rebounds one night after grabbing a team-record 24. He had only one rebound through three quarters. Joe Smith had 15 points and a season-high 13 rebounds. Terrell Brandon, who shot 4-of-16, had only his second turnover in five games. He has 53 assists in that span.

Game notes
With Evan Eschmeyer making his first start, Dallas has used 10 players for 14 lineups in 24 games. Minnesota has stuck with the same five all 22 games. ... The Timberwolves can't be happy that the Mavericks have a new arena. Minnesota had more wins at Reunion (13) than any other road site. ... The Timberwolves had outscored opponents 65-27 in the previous two third quarters. They got outscored 33-22 in the period by Dallas. ... The Mavericks activated Donnell Harvey from the injured list and put Johnny Newman on it with tendinitis in his left knee. ... This was only the second time Minnesota has lost in the 10 games Szczerbiak has scored at least 20 points. It's also the second time in nine games the Timberwolves have lost to a team over .500.
